name: Achai'ans
description: The most general term for “Greeks,” including the people of Ithaka, i.90; ii.7, etc.

name: A'cheron
description: River in the land of the dead, x.514.

name: Achil'leus
description: The great hero of the Iliad, whose ghost talked to Odysseus, xi.467, etc.

name: Adres'te
description: Handmaid of Helen, iv.122.

name: Agamem'non
description: Leader of the expedition against Troy, murdered by Aigisthos, i.30; iii.143, etc.

name: Agela'os
description: Son of Damastor, a suitor, xx.321, etc.; killed by Odysseus, xxii.293.

name: Aiai'a
description: Circe's island, x.135.

name: Ai'akos
description: Father of Peleus, grandfather of Achilleus, xi.471, 538.

name: Ai'as
description: (1) Son of Telamon, who quarreled with Odysseus over the armor of Achilleus, xi.469, etc.; (2) son of Oïleus, drowned by Poseidon, iv.499- 510.

name: Aie'tes
description: Brother of Circe, x.137; xii.70.

name: Ai'gai
description: City in Achaia, favored by Poseidon, v.381.

name: Aigis'thos
description: Son of Thyestes, lover of Klytaimestra and murderer of Agamemnon, killed by Orestes, i.29; iii.194, etc.

name: Aigyp'tios
description: Elder of Ithaka, father of Eurynomos, ii.15.

name: Aigy'ptos
description: The river of Egypt, the Nile, xiv.257.

name: Aio'lia
description: The island of Aiolos (1), x.1.

name: Ai'olos
description: (1) Mortal king in charge of the winds, x.1; (2) father of Kretheus, xi.237.

name: Ai'son
description: Son of Tyro and Kretheus, xi.259.

name: Aithio'pians
description: The Ethiopians, a distant people visited by Poseidon, i.22; v.282, etc.

name: Ai'thon
description: Name assumed by Odysseus in conversation with Penelope, xix.183.

name: Aito'lia
description: Country in central Greece, xiv.379.

name: Akas'tos
description: A king in western Greece, xiv.336.

name: Akro'neos
description: A Phaiakian, viii.111.

name: Ak'toris
description: Maid of Penelope, xxiii.228.

name: Alek'tor
description: A Spartan, whose daughter married Megapenthes, iv.10.

name: Alkan'dre
description: Lady of Thebes in Egypt, wife of Polybos (2), iv.126.

name: Al'kimos
description: Father of Mentor, xxii.234.

name: Alki'noös
description: King of the Phaiakians, vi.12; vii.185, etc.

name: Alkip'pe
description: Handmaid of Helen, iv.124.

name: Alkmai'on
description: Son of Amphiaraos, xv.248.

name: Alkme'ne
description: Mother of Herakles, ii.120; xi.266.

name: Alo'eus
description: Husband of Iphimedeia, putative father of Otos and Ephialtes, xi.305.

name: Alphei'os
description: River in the western Peloponnese, iii.489.

name: A'lybas
description: City of unknown location from which Odysseus pretended to have come, xxiv.304.

name: Amni'sos
description: A place in Crete, xix.188.

name: Amphi'alos
description: A Phaiakian, winner in jumping, viii.114; 128.

name: Amphiara'os
description: Son of Oïkles and grandfather of Theoklymenos. He was one of the seven against Thebes, xv.244-247.

name: Amphi'lochos
description: Son of Amphiaraos, xv.248.

name: Amphi'medon
description: One of the suitors, xxii.242; killed by Telemachos, xxii.284; his ghost told the ghost of Agamemnon about the slaughter of the suitors, xxiv.103.

name: Amphi'nomos
description: One of the suitors, xvi.351; son of Nisos, from Doulichion, best of the suitors and best liked by Penelope, xvi.394; befriended Odysseus and was warned by him, xviii. 119-150; killed by Telemachos, xxii.89-94.

name: Amphi'on
description: (1) Son of Antiope, and builder, with his brother Zethos, of Thebes, xi.262; (2) lord of Minyan Orchomenos, xi.283.

name: Amphi'thea
description: Grandmother of Odysseus, xix.416.

name: Amphitri'te
description: Queen of the sea, iii.91, etc.

name: Amphi'tryon
description: Husband of Alkmene, putative father of Herakles, xi.266.

name: Amytha'on
description: Son of Kretheus and Tyro, xi.259.

name: Anabasi'neos
description: A Phaiakian, viii.113.

name: Anchi'alos
description: (1) Father of Mentes, i.180; (2) a Phaiakian, viii.112.

name: Andrai'mon
description: Father of Thoas, xiv.499.

name: Antiklei'a
description: Mother of Odysseus, xi.85.

name: Anti'klos
description: One of the Achaians in the Wooden Horse, iv.286.

name: Anti'lochos
description: Son of Nestor, killed at Troy by Memnon, iii.112; iv.187, etc.

name: Anti'noös
description: Son of Eupeithes, one of the two leading suitors, i.383; ii.84, etc.; struck Odysseus with footstool, xvii.462; first to be killed, by Odysseus, xxii.8.

name: Anti'ope
description: Daughter of Asopos, mother of Amphion and Zethos, xi.260.

name: Anti'phates
description: (1) King of the Laistrygones, x.107; (2) father of Oïkles, xv.242.

name: An'tiphos
description: (1) Companion of Odysseus, killed by the Cyclops, ii.17; (2) an elder of Ithaka, xvii.68.

name: Apeir'e
description: The home of Eurymedousa, vii.8.

name: Aphei'das
description: Pretended name of Odysseus' father in his conversation with Laertes, xxiv.305.

name: Aphrodi'te
description: Daughter of Zeus, goddess of love and beauty, iv.14, etc. In the Odyssey (though not in the Iliad) she is the wife of Hephaistos, viii.267, etc.

name: Apol'lo
description: Or Phoibos Apollo, son of Zeus and Leto, iii.279, etc. He plays no major part in the Odyssey, but the day when the suitors are killed is a festival day for him, xx.278. His arrows, like those of Artemis, bring sudden and painless death, iii.280, etc.

name: Ar'es
description: Son of Zeus, god of war, lover of Aphrodite, viii.267, etc.

name: Are'te
description: Wife of Alkinoös, queen of the Phaiakians, vii.54, etc.

name: Arethou'sa
description: A spring on Ithaka, xiii.408.

name: Are'tos
description: Son of Nestor, iii.414.

name: Argeïphon'tes
description: “The slayer of Argos,” an epithet of Hermes, i.38; v.43, etc.

name: Ar'gives
description: The Greeks who went to Troy, i.61, etc.; also, the people of Mykene or Sparta, iii.309, etc.

name: Ar'go
description: The ship of the Argonauts, xii.69.

name: Ar'gos
description: The dog of Odysseus, xvii.292.

name: Ar'gos
description: City or district in the northeast Peloponnese, or simply “Greece,” i.344, iii.251, etc.

name: Ariad'ne
description: Daughter of Minos, killed by Artemis. Her ghost was seen by Odysseus in the land of the dead, xi.321.

name: Arkei'sios
description: Father of Laertes, xvi.118, etc.

name: Arnai'os
description: The true name of Iros, xviii.5.

name: Arta'kie
description: A spring on Lamos, x.108.

name: Ar'temis
description: Daughter of Zeus and Leto, sister of Apollo, vi.102, etc. Her arrows, like those of Apollo, bring sudden and painless death, xv.410, etc.

name: Aso'pos
description: A river and river god in Boiotia, father of Antiope, xi.260

name: A'rybas
description: A lord of Sidon, father of Eumaios' nurse, xv.426.

name: Asphal'ion
description: Henchman of Menelaos, iv.216.

name: As'teris
description: A little island off Ithaka, iv.846.

name: Athe'ne
description: Or Pallas Athene, goddess, daughter of Zeus, i.44, etc.

name: Ath'ens
description: The famous city in east-central Greece, iii.278.

name: At'las
description: Titan, father of Kalypso, i.52.

name: At'reus
description: Father of Agamemnon and Menelaos, i.35, etc.

name: Atryto'ne
description: Epithet of Athene, iv.762.

name: Auto'lykos
description: Father of Antikleia, so grandfather of Odysseus, xi.85; xix.394, etc.

name: Auto'noë
description: Handmaid of Penelope, xviii.182.

name: Bo'ëthoös
description: Father of Eteoneus, iv.31.

name: Boö'tes
description: The constellation of that name, v.272.

name: Chal'kis
description: A place on the west coast of Greece, opposite Ithaka, xv.295.

name: Charyb'dis
description: A monster of the coast in the form of a great whirlpool, xii.104, etc.

name: Chi'os
description: A large island off the coast of Asia Minor, iii.170.

name: Chlo'ris
description: Wife of Neleus and mother of Nestor, whose ghost Odysseus saw in the land of the dead, xi.281.

name: Chro'mios
description: Son of Neleus and Chloris, brother of Nestor, xi.286.

name: Cir'ce
description: The goddess and enchantress of Aiaia, Book x throughout, also viii.448; ix.31, etc.

name: Crete
description: Large island, domain of Idomeneus, iii.191, etc. Pretended home of Odysseus in various lying stories, xiii.256; xiv.199; xix.172.

name: Cyclo'pes
description: A monstrous people encountered by Odysseus and his men, ix.106, etc. In the singular, the Cyclops means Polyphemos, i.69; ii.19, etc.

name: Cy'prus
description: Large island in the easternmost Mediterranean, iv.83, etc.

name: Damas'tor
description: Father of Agelaos, xx.321.

name: Dan'aans
description: The Greeks who went to Troy, i.350, etc.

name: Dawn
description: Properly Eos, the goddess whose rising brings the day, ii.1; v.1, etc. Wife of Tithonos, v.1; mother of the killer of Antilochos (presumably Memnon), iv.188; in love with Orion, v.121; carried off Kleitos, xv.250.

name: Deï'phobos
description: Son of Priam, husband of Helen at the time of the fall of Troy, iv.276; viii.518.

name: De'los
description: Island in the Aigaian Sea, sacred to Apollo, vi.162.

name: Deme'ter
description: Sister of Zeus, who loved Iasion, v.125.

name: Demo'dokos
description: The blind singer of the Phaiakians, viii.44, etc.

name: Demopto'lemos
description: Suitor killed by Odysseus, xxii.242; 266.

name: Deuka'lion
description: King in Crete, father of Idomeneus, xix.180.

name: Di'a
description: An island in the Aigaian, xi.325.

name: Dio'kles
description: Lord of Pherai, iii.488; xv.186.

name: Diome'des
description: Son of Tydeus, a great hero of the Iliad, iii.180.

name: Diony'sos
description: God of wine, xxiv.75; accuser of Ariadne, xi.325.

name: Dme'tor
description: Son of Iasos (2), king of Cyprus, xvii.443.

name: Dodo'na
description: Site of an oracle of Zeus in northwestern Greece, xiv.327; xix.296.

name: Do'lios
description: An old servant, specially attached to Penelope, iv.735; works on the estate with Laertes, xxiv.222; father of Melanthios, xvii.212; of Melantho, xviii.322.

name: Dor'ians
description: Presumably, the “conquerors,” located by Odysseus in Crete, xix.177.

name: Douli'chion
description: A large, but not positively identified, island in the domain of Odysseus, i.246, etc. (In the Iliad, it is in the domain of Meges.)

name: Dy'mas
description: A Phaiakian, father of Nausikaa's best friend, vi.22.

name: Echene'os
description: Aged Phaiakian counselor, vii.155; xi.342.

name: Eche'phron
description: A son of Nestor, iii.413.

name: E'chetos
description: A cruel king somewhere in western Greece, xviii.85; xxi.308.

name: E'gypt
description: The country, iii.300; iv.351, etc.

name: Eido'thea
description: Sea nymph, daughter of Proteus, iv.365.

name: Eileithyi'a
description: The goddess of childbirth, xix.188.

name: E'latos
description: A suitor, killed by Eumaios, xxii.267.

name: Elat'reus
description: A Phaiakian, viii.111.

name: E'lis
description: City and district of the western Peloponnese, opposite Ithaka, iv.635, etc.

name: Elpe'nor
description: Companion of Odysseus, killed by accidentally falling from the roof, x.552; Odysseus talked with his ghost, xi.51.

name: Ely'sian Field
description: The far fortunate place where Menelaos is ultimately to find his home, iv.563.

name: E'nipeus
description: A river in Thessaly, loved by Tyro, xi.238.

name: Epei'ans
description: People of Elis, xiii.275, etc.

name: Epei'os
description: The builder of the Wooden Horse, viii.493; xi.524.

name: Eper'itos
description: Name assumed by Odysseus when he talked with Laertes, xxiv.306.

name: Ephial'tes
description: Son of Poseidon and Iphimedeia, brother of Otos, gigantic child killed by Apollo, xi.308.

name: E'phyre
description: Place of unknown location, apparently in Western Greece, i.259; ii.328.

name: Epikas'te
description: More familiarly known as Iokaste, the wife and mother of Oidipodes, xi.271.

name: E'rebos
description: The dark place of the dead, x.528.

name: Erech'theus
description: Hero of Athens, vii.81.

name: Erem'boi
description: An unidentified people visited by Menelaos during his wanderings, iv.84.

name: Eret'meus
description: A Phaiakian, viii.112.

name: Eriphy'le
description: Wife of Amphiaraos, who caused his death, xi.326.

name: Eryman'thos
description: A mountain in the northwest Peloponnese, vi.104.

name: Eri'nys
description: Fury, or a goddess of curses, xv.234.

name: Eteo'neus
description: Henchman of Menelaos, iv.22.

name: Eteokre'tans
description: A people of Crete, thought to mean “True-Cretans,” xix.176.

name: Euan'thes
description: Father of Maron, ix.197.

name: Euboi'a
description: A large island east of central Greece, iii.175; vii.321.

name: Eue'nor
description: Father of Leokritos, ii.242, etc.

name: Eumai'os
description: The noble swineherd of Odysseus, xiv.55, etc.

name: Eume'los
description: Lord of Pherai, husband of Iphthime, thus brother-in-law of Penelope, iv.798.

name: Eupei'thes
description: Father of Antinoös, i.383, etc.; killed by Laertes in the final battle, xxiv.523.

name: Eury'ades
description: Suitor, killed by Telemachos, xxii.267.

name: Eury'alos
description: A young Phaiakian, rude to Odysseus, viii.158, etc.

name: Eury'bates
description: The herald of Odysseus, xix.247.

name: Eury'damas
description: A suitor, xviii.297; killed by Odysseus, xxii.283.

name: Eury'dike
description: Daughter of Klymenos, wife of Nestor, iii.451.

name: Euryklei'a
description: The old nurse of Odysseus and of Telemachos, i.428, etc.

name: Eury'lochos
description: Second in command of Odysseus' fleet, x.205, etc.; a relative of Odysseus, though sometimes at odds with him, x.441.

name: Eury'machos
description: Son of Polybos (1). One of the two leading suitors, i.399; ii.177, etc.; attacked Odysseus, xviii.394; killed by Odysseus, xxii.79.

name: Eury'medon
description: King of the giants, father of Periboia, vii.58.

name: Eurymedou'sa
description: Nurse of Nausikaa, vii.8.

name: Eu'rymos
description: Father of Telemos, ix.509.

name: Eury'nome
description: Housekeeper and nurse of Penelope, xvii.495, etc.

name: Eury'nomos
description: Suitor, son of Aigyptios, ii.21; xxii.242.

name: Eury'pylos
description: Leader of the Keteians, killed at Troy by Neoptolemos, xi.520.

name: Eury'tion
description: A drunken centaur, xxi.295.

name: Eu'rytos
description: Father of Iphitos, archer, king of Oichalia, killed by Apollo, viii.224, etc.

name: Gai'a
description: Mother of Tityos, vii.324.

name: Gerais'tos
description: Promontory on the island of Euboia, iii.178.

name: Gere'nian
description: Epithet of Nestor, iii.68, etc.

name: Gor'gon
description: A staring monster, xi.635.

name: Gor'tys
description: A place in Crete, iii.294.

name: Gra'ces
description: Properly, the Charites, goddesses of beauty, vi.18, etc.

name: Gy'rai
description: A rocky island in the Aigaian Sea, iv.501.

name: Ha'des
description: Properly Aïdes, lord of the dead, iv.834; xi.47, etc.

name: Ha'lios
description: A son of Alkinoös, viii.119.

name: Halither'ses
description: An Ithakan, gifted in prophecy, favorable to Odysseus, ii.157; xxiv.451, etc.

name: He'be
description: Daughter of Zeus and Hera, bride of Herakles after his immortalization, xi.604.

name: He'len
description: Wife of Menelaos, the cause of the war, iv.12, etc.

name: He'lios
description: The sun god, i.8, etc. Odysseus' men slaughtered some of his cattle, xii.260-390.

name: Hel'las
description: A name for the country of Achilleus (as in the Iliad) xi.496; more widely, apparently as “Greece” generally, i.344, etc.

name: Hel'lespont
description: The strait (Dardanelles) by Troy, xxiv.82.

name: Hephais'tos
description: The immortal artificer, iv.617, etc.; in the Odyssey (not in the Iliad) married to Aphrodite, who played him false with Ares (according to the song of Demodokos), viii.266-366.

name: He'ra
description: Wife of Zeus, queen of the gods, iv.513.

name: Her'akles
description: Or Hercules, son of Alkmene and Zeus, xi.268; a great archer, xiii.224; killer of Iphitos, xxi.26; immortalized and married to Hebe, xi.601-604.

name: Her'mes
description: Often called Argeïphontes, son of Zeus and Maia, messenger of Zeus, i.38, etc.

name: Hermi'one
description: Daughter of Menelaos and Helen, iv.14.

name: Hippodamei'a
description: Handmaid of Penelope, xviii.182.

name: Hip'potas
description: Father of Aiolos (1), x.2.

name: Hy'lakos
description: Father of Kastor (2), xiv.204.

name: Hyperei'a
description: Former home of the Phaiakians, near the Cyclopes, vi.4.

name: Hypere'sia
description: City in Achaia, home of Polypheides, xv.254.

name: Hyperi'on
description: (1) Epithet of Helios, i.24, etc.; (2) father of Helios, xii.176.

name: Iar'danos
description: River in Crete, iii.292.

name: Ias'ion
description: Hero beloved by Demeter, v.126.

name: I'asos
description: (1) Father of Amphion (2), xi.283; (2) father of Dmetor, xvii.443.

name: Ido'meneus
description: Lord of Crete, a great hero of the Iliad, iii.191; xiii.259, etc.

name: Ika'rios
description: The father of Penelope, i.328, etc.

name: Ikma'lios
description: Artificer, who made Penelope's chair, xix.57.

name: I'lion
description: The city of Troy, ii.18, etc.

name: I'los
description: Son of Mermeros, apparently king of Ephyra, i.259.

name: I'no
description: Also called Leukothea, daughter of Kadmos, once mortal, now a sea goddess, v.333; 461.

name: Iol'kos
description: Place in Thessaly, home of Pelias, xi.257.

name: I'phikles
description: Lord of Phylake, captor of Melampous, xi.290.

name: Imphimedei'a
description: Mother of Otos and Ephialtes, xi.305.

name: I'phitos
description: Son of Eurytos, friend of the young Odysseus, foully murdered by Herakles, giver of the great bow to Odysseus, xxi.11-41.

name: Iphthi'me
description: Wife of Eumelos and sister of Penelope, to whom she appeared in a dream, iv.797.

name: I'ros
description: The name Arnaios commonly went by; the beggar who fought with Odysseus, xviii.1-107; so named after the goddess Iris, who otherwise does not appear in the Odyssey, xviii.6.

name: Is'maros
description: Thracian home of the Kikonians, ix.40.

name: I'thaka
description: Island off the west coast of Greece, i.18, etc., home of Odysseus; its position described, ix.21-26.

name: I'thakos
description: Builder of a well on Ithaka, xvii.207.

name: I'tylos
description: Son of Zethos (2) and “the nightingale,” daughter of Pandareos (presumably Prokne), killed by his mother, xix.523.

name: Ja'son
description: Master of the ship Argo, xii.72.

name: Kadmei'ans
description: The people of Thebes (2), xi.276.

name: Kad'mos
description: Founder of Thebes (2), father of Ino, v.333.

name: Kalyp'so
description: Goddess-nymph, daughter of Atlas, i.14; 52; befriended and lived with Odysseus, v.14-268, etc.

name: Kassan'dra
description: Daughter of Priam, captive mistress of Agamemnon, murdered with him, xi.422.

name: Kas'tor
description: (1) Son of Leda and Tyndareos, brother of Polydeukes, semi- immortalized by Zeus, xi.298-304; (2) son of Hylakos, pretended father of Odysseus in his story as told to Eumaios, xiv.204.

name: Kauko'nes
description: A people, presumably near Pylos. Athene, disguised as Mentor, announces that she will visit them, iii.366. Apparently, therefore, they are not the same as the people in the Iliad mentioned at Iliad X.429 and XX.329.

name: Kephallen'ians
description: People of Kephallenia or, especially in Book xxiv, of the whole community of islands, xx.210; xxiv.355; 377; 429.

name: Ketei'ans
description: The people of Eurypylos, xi.520.

name: Kiko'nians
description: The Thracians of Ismaros, raided by Odysseus, ix.39-61.

name: Kimmer'ians
description: A people near the land of the dead, xi.14. In historical times, the name applies to a non-Greek people of the Black Sea who raided Asia Minor in the seventh century B.C.

name: Klei'tos
description: Son of Mantios, snatched away by the Dawn, xv.250.

name: Kly'mene
description: Heroine seen by Odysseus in the land of the dead, xi.326.

name: Kly'menos
description: Father of Eurydike, iii.452.

name: Klytaimes'tra
description: Agamemnon's wife, who took Aigisthos as a lover, iii.265- 272; accomplice in Agamemnon's murder, and murdered Kassandra, xi.421-434.

name: Kly'tios
description: Father of Peiraios, xv.540.

name: Klytone'os
description: A son of Alkinoös, viii.119.

name: Knos'sos
description: A city in Crete, xix.178.

name: Koky'tos
description: A river in the land of the dead, x.513.

name: Kratai'ïs
description: Mother of Skylla, xii.124.

name: Krei'on
description: Father of Megara, xi.269.

name: Kre'theus
description: Son of Aiolos (2), husband of Tyro, father of Aison, Pheres, and Amythaon, xi.258, etc.

name: Kro'nos
description: Father of Zeus, i.386, etc.

name: Kro'unoi
description: A place on the western coast of Greece, opposite Ithaka, xv.295.

name: Kte'sios
description: Father of Eumaios, xv.414.

name: Ktesip'pos
description: A violent suitor, who threw a cow's hoof at Odysseus, xx.288- 303; killed by Philoitios, xxii.285.

name: Kti'mene
description: The sister of Odysseus, xv.363.

name: Kydo'nians
description: A people of Crete, iii.292; xix.176.

name: Kylle'ne
description: Mountain in Arkadia, the home of Hermes, xxiv.1.

name: Kythe'ra
description: Island off the southern tip of Greece, ix.81.

name: Kytherei'a
description: Aphrodite, the lady of Kythera, viii.288; xviii.193.

name: Laer'kes
description: Goldsmith in Pylos, iii.425.

name: Laer'tes
description: Son of Arkeisios, father of Odysseus, i.189, etc. Rejuvenated by Athene, fights in the last battle, xxiv. 513-525.

name: Laistry'gones
description: A giant cannibal people encountered by Odysseus and his men, x.80-132.

name: Lakedai'mon
description: The country of Sparta, domain of Menelaos, iii.326, etc.

name: La'mos
description: The city of the Laistrygones, x.81.

name: Lampe'tia
description: Nymph, daughter of Helios and Neaira, who tended her father's cattle, xii.132; 374.

name: Lam'pos
description: One of the Dawn's horses, xxiii.246.

name: Lao'damas
description: Favorite son of Alkinoös, vii. 170; viii.117, etc.

name: La'pithai
description: The people of Peirithoös, xxi.297.

name: Le'da
description: Wife of Tyndareos, mother of Kastor and Polydeukes, xi.298.

name: Lem'nos
description: Island in the northern Aigaian, favored by Hephaistos, viii.283, etc.

name: Leo'des
description: A weak and well-meaning suitor, with prophetic skill, xxi.144, etc.; killed by Odysseus while begging for mercy, xxii. 310-329.

name: Leo'kritos
description: A suitor, ii.242; killed by Telemachos, xxii.294.

name: Les'bos
description: Island off Asia Minor, where Odysseus wrestled with Philomeleides, iv.342, etc.

name: Le'to
description: Mother (by Zeus) of Artemis and Apollo, vi.106, etc.; Tityos tormented after death for assaulting her, xi.580.

name: Leuko'thea
description: Ino's name as a divinity, v.333.

name: Lib'ya
description: The Greek name for Africa, iv.85; xiv,295.

name: Lotus-Eaters
description: Mysterious people visited by Odysseus and his men, ix.82- 104.

name: Mai'a
description: Mother of Hermes, xiv.436, etc.

name: Mai'ra
description: Heroine seen by Odysseus in the land of the dead, xi.326.

name: Malei'a
description: Southeastern cape on the mainland of Greece, iii.288, etc.

name: Man'tios
description: Son of Melampous, grandfather of Theoklymenos, xv.242.

name: Ma'rathon
description: District near Athens, favored by Athene (also, site of the subsequent battle), vii.80.

name: Ma'ron
description: Priest of Apollo at Ismaros, ix.197.

name: Mas'tor
description: Father of Halitherses, ii.157; xxiv.451.

name: Me'don
description: Herald of Odysseus in Ithaka, loyal to Penelope and Telemachos, iv.677, etc.; spared by Odysseus after the slaughter, xxii.361.

name: Megapen'thes
description: Son of Menelaos and a slave girl, iv.11; xv.100, etc.

name: Me'gara
description: Daughter of Kreion, wife of Herakles, xi.269.

name: Melam'pous
description: A famous soothsayer, xi.291; xv.256.

name: Mel'aneus
description: Father of Amphimedon, xxiv.103.

name: Melan'thios
description: Son of Dolios, goatherd who sided with the suitors and insulted and kicked Odysseus, xvii.212, etc.; aided the suitors in their battle, xxii.135; mutilated by Telemachos and the herdsmen, xxii.474.

name: Melan'tho
description: Daughter of Dolios, favored but treacherous maid of Penelope, xviii.321; xix.65.

name: Mem'non
description: Son of the Dawn, see iii.112 (where, however, he is not named); handsomest of men, xi.522.

name: Menela'os
description: Husband of Helen, great hero of the Iliad, iv.2, etc.

name: Menoi'tios
description: Father of Patroklos, xxiv.77.

name: Men'tes
description: Name assumed by Athene on her first visit to Telemachos, i.105, etc.

name: Men'tor
description: Ithakan friend of Odysseus, to whom he entrusted his household when he went to Troy, ii.225, etc.; frequently impersonated by Athene, ii.268; xxii.206; xxiv.548, etc.

name: Mer'meros
description: Father of Ilos, i.259.

name: Mesaul'ios
description: Thrall of Eumaios, xiv.449.

name: Messe'ne
description: Territory in southwestern Greece, xxi.15.

name: Mi'mas
description: A mountainous promontory of Asia Minor, opposite Chios, iii.172.

name: Mi'nos
description: Son of Zeus and king of Crete, xix.178; judge in the land of the dead, xi.568; father of Ariadne, xi.322.

name: Min'yan
description: Name applied to Orchomenos, xi.284.

name: Mou'lios
description: Doulichian herald attached to Amphinomos, xviii.423.

name: Myke'ne
description: (1) a fabulous heroine of the past, ii.120; (2) the city of Agamemnon, iii.304.

name: Myr'midons
description: The people of Achilleus and Neoptolemos, iii.188, etc.

name: Nau'bolos
description: Father of Euryalos, viii.115.

name: Nausi'kaa
description: Daughter of Alkinoös and Arete, who befriended Odysseus, vi.17, etc.

name: Nausi'thoös
description: Founder of the Phaiakian settlement on Scheria, vi.7; son of

name: Poseidon and father of Rhexenor and Alkinoös, vii. 56-63.
Nau'teus
description: A Phaiakian, viii.112.

name: Neai'ra
description: Wife of Helios, mother of Phaethousa and Lampetia, xii.133.

name: Ne'leus
description: Father of Nestor, former king in Pylos, iii.409, etc.

name: Neopto'lemos
description: Son of Achilleus, xi.506.

name: Ne'rikos
description: Place (on Leukas) once taken by Laertes, xxiv.378.

name: Ne'ritos
description: (1) Mountain of Ithaka, xiii.351; (2) builder of a well on Ithaka, xvii.207.

name: Nes'tor
description: The old hero of the Iliad, king in Pylos, i.284; iii.17, etc.

name: Ni'sos
description: King in Doulichion, father of Amphinomos, xviii.127, etc.

name: Noë'mon
description: Ithakan friend of Telemachos, who lent him his ship, ii.386; iv.630.

name: Ocean
description: Or Oke'anos, the waters surrounding the world and the god of those waters, iv.567; x.139; xi.639, etc.

name: Odys'seus
description: The hero, first mentioned by name, i.21; son of Laertes, iv.555, etc.; and of Antikleia, xi.85.

name: Ogy'gia
description: Kalypso's island, i.85, etc.

name: Oidi'podes
description: Or Oedipus, hero of Thebes (1), xi.271 (in Homer, strictly, Oidipodes).

name: Oï'kles
description: Father of Amphiaraos, xv.243.

name: Oi'nops
description: Father of Leodes, xxi.144.

name: Oky'alos
description: A Phaiakian, viii.111.

name: Olym'pos
description: The home of the gods, i.102, etc.; described, vi.42.

name: One'tor
description: Father of Phrontis, iii.282.

name: Ops
description: Father of Eurykleia, i.429.

name: Orcho'menos
description: Minyan city in Boiotia, xi.284.

name: Ores'tes
description: The son of Agamemnon, who avenged him, i.30; 298; iii.306, etc.

name: Ori'on
description: A hero loved by the Dawn, killed by Artemis, v.121; his ghost seen by Odysseus in the land of the dead, xi.572; as a constellation, v.274.

name: Or'menos
description: Father of Ktesios, xv.414.

name: Orsi'lochos
description: Son of Idomeneus, in a story told by Odysseus, xiii.260.

name: Orti'lochos
description: Father of Diokles, iii.489; host to Odysseus in Messene, xxi.16.

name: Orty'gia
description: A place of uncertain location, where Artemis killed Orion, v.123; a place (the same?) “where the sun makes his turnings,” near the Homeric Syria, xv.404.

name: Os'sa
description: A mountain in Thessaly, xi.315.

name: O'tos
description: Son of Poseidon and Iphimedeia, brother of Ephialtes, gigantic child killed by Apollo, xi.308.

name: Paië'on
description: The god of medicine, iv.232.

name: Pal'las
description: Epithet of Athene, i.125, etc.

name: Pandar'eos
description: Father of “the nightingale,” xix.518; his daughters carried away by the stormwinds, xx.66.

name: Pan'opeus
description: A city in Phokis, xi.581.

name: Paph'os
description: A place on Cyprus, favored by Aphrodite, viii.362.

name: Parnas'sos
description: A great mountain in central Greece, xix.394, etc.

name: Patrok'los
description: Companion of Achilleus, a great hero of the Iliad, iii.110, etc.

name: Peirai'os
description: Man of Ithaka, friend and companion of Telemachos, xv.540, etc.

name: Peiri'thoös
description: Hero of former times, friend of Theseus, xi.631; king of the Lapiths, who punished Eurytion, xxi.296.

name: Peisan'dros
description: Son of Polyktor, a suitor, xviii.299; killed by Philoitios, xxii.268.

name: Peise'nor
description: (1) Herald in Ithaka, ii.37; (2) father of Ops, grandfather of Eurykleia, i.429, etc.

name: Peisis'tratos
description: Son of Nestor, greets Telemachos and Athene, iii.36; accompanies Telemachos to Sparta, iii.482, etc.

name: Pelas'gians
description: A mysterious people, variously located in the Iliad; in the Odyssey, they are found in Crete, xix.177.

name: Pe'leus
description: Father of Achilleus, v.310, etc.

name: Pe'lias
description: Son of Tyro and Poseidon, king in Iolkos, xi.256.

name: Pe'lion
description: A mountain in Thessaly, xi.316.

name: Pene'lope
description: Daughter of Ikarios, wife of Odysseus, i.223, etc.

name: Periboi'a
description: Daughter of Eurymedon, mother, by Poseidon, of Nausithoös, vii.57.

name: Perikly'menos
description: Son of Neleus and Chloris, brother of Nestor, xi.286.

name: Perime'des
description: A companion of Odysseus, xi.23; etc.

name: Pe'ro
description: Daughter of Neleus and Chloris, a great beauty, xi.287.

name: Per'se
description: Nymph, daughter of Ocean, x.139.

name: Perse'phone
description: Goddess, wife of Hades, queen over the dead, x.491, xi.47, etc.

name: Per'seus
description: Son of Nestor, iii.414 (not to be confused with the gorgon slayer).

name: Pha'ethon
description: One of the Dawn's horses, xxiii.246.

name: Phaethou'sa
description: Nymph, daughter of Helios and Neaira, who tended her father's cattle, xii.132.

name: Phaia'kians
description: The people of Alkinoös, v.35, etc.

name: Phai'dimos
description: King of the Sidonians, friend of Menelaos, iv.617.

name: Phaid'ra
description: Heroine seen by Odysseus in the land of the dead, xi.321.

name: Phais'tos
description: City in Crete, iii.296.

name: Pha'ros
description: Island off Egypt where Menelaos captured Proteus, iv.355.

name: Phe'ai
description: A place on the mainland opposite Ithaka, xv.297.

name: Phei'don
description: King of Thesprotia, xiv.316.

name: Phe'mios
description: Son of Terpias, the singer who sang for the suitors, i.154, etc.; his life spared by Odysseus, xxii.331.

name: Phe'rai
description: (1) A place in Thessaly, the home of Eumelos, iv. 798; (2) a place between Pylos and Sparta, the home of Diokles, iii.488.

name: Phe'res
description: Son of Kretheus and Tyro, xi.259.

name: Philoi'tios
description: The oxherd who remained loyal to Odysseus, xx.185, etc.

name: Philokte'tes
description: A great hero and master bowman of the Trojan War, iii.190; viii.219.

name: Philomele'ïdes
description: A wrestler of Lesbos, thrown by Odysseus, iv.343.

name: Phoeni'cia, Phoeni'cians
description: A nation and its people, noted as seafarers, traders, and slave traders, living on the Syrian coast, iv.83; xiv.288, etc. Phoi'bos: Epithet of Apollo, iii.279, etc.

name: Phor'kys
description: An old man of the sea, xiii.345; father of Thoö'sa, i.72.

name: Phron'ios
description: Father of Noëmon, ii.386, etc.

name: Phron'tis
description: Son of Onetor, the steersman of Menelaos, iii.282.

name: Phthi'a
description: The home of Achilleus, xi.496.

name: Phy'lake
description: The home of Iphikles, xi. 290; xv.236.

name: Phy'lakos
description: A hero, possibly the same person as Iphikles, who imprisoned Melampous, xv.231.

name: Phy'lo
description: Handmaid of Helen, iv.125.

name: Pie'ria
description: Mountainous district near Mount Olympos, v.50.

name: Plei'ades
description: The constellation, v.272.

name: Poi'as
description: Father of Philoktetes, iii.190.

name: Poli'tes
description: A companion of Odysseus, x.224.

name: Pol'ybos
description: (1) Father of Eurymachos, i.399; (2) man of Egyptian Thebes, visited by Menelaos and Helen, iv.126; (3) craftsman, who made a ball used by the Phaiakians, viii.373; (4) suitor, xxii.243; killed by Eumaios, xxii.284.

name: Polydam'na
description: Egyptian lady, wife of Thon, who gave Helen a tranquilizing drug, iv.228.

name: Polydeu'kes
description: Son of Leda and Tyndareos, brother of Kastor (1), semi- immortalized by Zeus, xi.298-304.

name: Polykas'te
description: Youngest daughter of Nestor, who gave Telemachos a bath, iii.464.

name: Polyk'tor
description: (1) Builder of a well on Ithaka, xvii.207; (2) father of Peisandros, xviii.299.

name: Polyne'os
description: Father of Amphialos, viii.114.

name: Polype'mon
description: Father of Apheidas, xxiv.305.

name: Polyphei'des
description: Son of Mantios, a prophet, father of Theoklymenos, xv.249- 256.

name: Polyphe'mos
description: Greatest of the Cyclopes, son of Poseidon, blinded by Odysseus, i.70; ix.403, etc.

name: Polyther'ses
description: Father of Ktesippos, xxii.287.

name: Pon'teus
description: A Phaiakian, viii.113.

name: Ponto'noös
description: Herald of Alkinoös, vii.182, etc.

name: Posei'don
description: Brother of Zeus, lord of the sea, enemy of Odysseus, i.20, etc.; father of Polyphemos, i.68-73, etc.

name: Pramnei'an wine
description: A wine used medicinally, origin unknown, x.235.

name: Pri'am
description: King of Troy, iii.107, etc.

name: Prok'ris
description: Heroine seen by Odysseus in the land of the dead, xi.321.

name: Pro'reus
description: A Phaiakian, viii.113.

name: Pro'teus
description: The old man of the sea, iv.365-570.

name: Prym'neus
description: A Phaiakian, i.112.

name: Psy'rios
description: Island off Chios, iii.171.

name: Py'los
description: The city of Nestor on the southwest coast of Greece, i.93, etc.

name: Pyriphle'gethon
description: A river in the land of the dead, x.513.

name: Py'tho
description: Apollo's sanctuary on the slopes of Mount Parnassos, viii.80; xi.581.

name: Rhadaman'thys
description: Presumably king in the Elysian Field, iv.564.

name: Rhei'thron
description: Harbor on Ithaka, i.186.

name: Rhexe'nor
description: Son of Nausithoös, father of Arete, vii.63.

name: Roving Rocks
description: Located near the Sirens, xii.61; xxiii.327.

name: Salmo'neus
description: Father of Tyro, xi.236.

name: Sam'e or Samos
description: Large island (later Kephallenia), next to Ithaka and in the domain of Odysseus, i.246, etc.

name: Sche'ria
description: The land of the Phaiakians, v.34, etc.

name: Sicilian
description: Used of a people referred to as dealing in slaves, xx.383; provenence of Laertes' slave woman, xxiv.211, etc. (actually, the word is Si'kelos, which in Greek elsewhere refers to a native people in Sicily, or Sike'lia).

name: Si'don, Sidon'ia
description: City of the Phoenicians, xiii.286, etc.

name: Sika'nia
description: A place referred to by Odysseus, perhaps to be identified with Sicily, xxiv.307.

name: Sin'tians
description: Friends of Hephaistos in Lemnos, who spoke an uncouth language, viii.294.

name: Si'rens
description: Singing, dangerous creatures of the sea, xii.39, etc.

name: Sis'yphos
description: Hero tormented in the land of the dead, condemned to roll a stone forever uphill, xi.593.

name: Skyl'la
description: A man-eating monster who preyed on Odysseus' men, xii.85; 245, etc.

name: Sky'ros
description: Island from which Odysseus brought Neoptolemos to Troy, xi.509.

name: So'lymoi
description: A people visited by Poseidon, v.283.

name: Sou'nion
description: A sea cape of Attika, near Athens, iii.278.

name: Spar'ta
description: The city of Menelaos, i.93, etc.

name: Stra'tios
description: A son of Nestor, iii.413.

name: Styx
description: The river or waterfall by which the gods swear, v.185; located in the land of the dead, x.514.

name: Sy'ria
description: An island of uncertain location, the original home of Eumaios, xv.403.

name: Tan'talos
description: Hero tormented in the land of the dead, xi.582.

name: Taph'ians
description: A people, not certainly located, on or near the western coast of Greece, i.105; xiv.452.

name: Taÿ'getos
description: A mountain range in Lakedaimon, vi.103.

name: Teire'sias
description: Theban seer, who retained his powers even in the land of the dead, x.492, etc.; consulted by Odysseus and foretells his future, xi.90- 137.

name: Tek'ton
description: Father of Polyneos, viii.114.

name: Te'lamon
description: The father of Aias (1), xi.553.

name: Tele'machos
description: The thoughtful son of Odysseus and Penelope, i.113, etc.

name: Te'lemos
description: Prophet of the Cyclopes, ix.509.

name: Te'lephos
description: Father of Eurypylos, xi.519.

name: Tele'pylos
description: City of the Laistrygones, x.82.

name: Te'mese
description: Place alleged to be her destination by Athene disguised as Mentes, i.184.

name: Te'nedos
description: Island off Asia Minor, near Troy, iii.159.

name: Ter'pias
description: Father of Phemios, xxii.330 (but the form of his name is uncertain).

name: Thebes
description: (1) City of Egypt, iv.127; (2) city of the Kadmeians in Boiotia, xv.247, etc.

name: The'mis
description: Goddess of what is right and proper, who supervises the assemblies of men, ii.68.

name: Theokly'menos
description: A man of prophetic family, fugitive from Argos, befriended by Telemachos, xv.223, etc. (first named, xv.256).

name: The'seus
description: Great hero of Athens, who carried Ariadne away from Crete, xi.322, etc.

name: Thespro'tians
description: A people of the northwest mainland, xiv.315, etc.

name: The'tis
description: Nereid, married to Peleus, mother of Achilleus, xxiv.91.

name: Tho'as
description: Son of Andraimon, hero at Troy, xiv.499.

name: Thon
description: Egyptian, husband of Polydamna, iv.228.

name: Tho'ön
description: A Phaiakian, viii.113.

name: Thoö'sa
description: A nymph, daughter of Phorkys, mother of Polyphemos, i.71.

name: Thrace
description: Territory north of Greece, favored home of Ares, viii.361.

name: Thrsyme'des
description: Son of Nestor, iii.39, etc.

name: Thrina'kia
description: The island of Helios, where his sacred cattle were pastured, xi.107; xii.127, etc.

name: Thyes'tes
description: Father of Aigisthos, iv.517.

name: Titho'nos
description: The husband of the Dawn, v.1.

name: Ti'tyos
description: A hero tormented in the land of the dead, xi.576; mentioned, vii.324.

name: Tritogenei'a
description: A name for Athene, iii, 378.

name: Tro'jans
description: The people of Troy, i.237, etc.

name: Troy
description: The domain of Priam, whose city was Ilion, i.2, etc.

name: Ty'deus
description: Father of Diomedes, iii.167, etc.

name: Tynda'reos
description: Father of Kastor and Polydeukes, xi.298; of Klytaimestra, xxiv.199.

name: Ty'ro
description: A fabulous queen, ii.120; her ghost talked with Odysseus in the land of the dead, xi.235.

name: Zakyn'thos
description: Large island, part of the domain of Odysseus, i.246, etc.

name: Ze'thos
description: (1) Son of Antiope, and builder, with his brother Amphion, of Thebes, xi.262; (2) father of Itylos, xix.523.

name: Zeus
description: Son of Kronos, most powerful of the gods, i.10, etc.
